alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 09 at 3:34AM PST until December 10 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM PST SATURDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected above 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches and ice accumulations of around a tenth of an inch. Local winds gusting as high as 45 mph will cause blowing and drifting of snow. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 7 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow accumulations greater than 10 inches are expected near the crest.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades
